    FOKUS questionnaire schema

Get proposal argument

Source: R/fokus.gen.R
proposal_argument.Rd

Returns the specified proposal argument's text of the specified type in the specified language.

Usage

proposal_argument(
  ballot_date = all_ballot_dates,
  lvl = lvls(ballot_date, canton, ballot_type = "referendum"),
  canton = cantons(ballot_date),
  proposal_nr = 1L,
  argument_nr = 1L,
  side = all_argument_sides,
  lang = c("de", "en"),
  type = c("short", "long")
)

Arguments

ballot_date

FOKUS-covered ballot date. One of

  • "2018-09-23"

  • "2018-11-25"

  • "2019-10-20"

  • "2020-09-27"

  • "2020-10-18"

  • "2021-11-28"

lvl

Political level. One of

  • "cantonal"

  • "federal"

canton

Canton name. One of

  • "aargau"

Only relevant if lvl = "cantonal".

proposal_nr

Proposal number. A positive integerish scalar.

argument_nr

Proposal argument number. A positive integerish scalar.

side

Proposal argument side. One of

  • "pro"

  • "contra"

lang

Language. One of

  • "de"

  • "en"

type

Name type. One of

  • "short"

  • "long"

Value

A character scalar.

See also

Other proposal predicate functions: n_proposal_arguments(), n_proposal_main_motives(), proposal_arguments(), proposal_main_motives(), proposal_name_gender(), proposal_name(), proposal_type()

Examples

fokus::proposal_argument(ballot_date = "2018-09-23",
                         lvl = "cantonal",
                         canton = "aargau",
                         proposal_nr = 1,
                         argument_nr = 3,
                         side = "contra",
                         type = "long")
#> [1] "Die Steuern im Kanton Aargau sollten generell möglichst tief sein."
